intro: Espeletiopsis angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf espeletiopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a distinctive blue-green coloration. Espeletiopsis angustifolia is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine meadows.
